p: In general, the bioactive molecules of the volatile oil are camphor, 1,8-cineol, pinene, borneol, camphene, limonene, verbenone, caryophyllene, myrcene, and triterpenes (such as betulin and Î±-amyrin).The rosemary essential oil is utilised in lotions for the treatment of ailments, such as arthritis, gout, muscular pain, neuralgia, and wounds [ 163, 164, 167, 168, 169, 170].
